content.question: Let <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the function defined by <math alttext="f of x, equals, the fraction with numerator x to the fifth power, and denominator 20, end fraction, minus the fraction with numerator x to the fourth power, and denominator 12, end fraction, minus the fraction with numerator x cubed, and denominator 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>20</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>12</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>. The graph of <math alttext="f prime" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>, the derivative of <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, is shown above. On which of the following intervals is the graph of <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> concave up?

choices.label: <math alttext="x is less than negative 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="0 is less than x, which is less than 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="negative 1 is less than x, which is less than 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mrow><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="x is greater than 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>></mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="x is less than, two thirds minus the fraction with numerator 2 times the square root of 10, and denominator 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><msqrt><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="x is greater than, two thirds plus the fraction with numerator 2 times the square root of 10, and denominator 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>></mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><msqrt><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="two thirds minus the fraction with numerator 2 times the square root of 10, and denominator 3, is less than x, which is less than two thirds plus the fraction with numerator 2 times the square root of 10, and denominator 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><msqrt><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><msqrt><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="negative 1 is less than x, which is less than 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mrow><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="x is greater than 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>></mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 5.6: Determining Concavity of Functions over Their Domains

skill.text: Skill 2.E: Describe the relationships among different representations of functions and their derivatives.
